snippet: Hildreth Meière is not exactly a household name, but her Art Deco mosaics and murals live on landmarks in New York.
abstract: Hildreth Meiere, most prominent muralist of the 1920s, radically advanced her field and helped introduce America to the modernism of Art Deco; Meiere's work went largely unrecognized for decades, but her mosaics and murals live on at several prominent landmarks in New York City.
lead_paragraph: Hildreth Meière is not exactly a household name, but her Art Deco mosaics and murals live on landmarks in New York.

headline.seo: Hildreth Meière, the Forgotten Art Deco Artist
headline.main: If These Walls Could Speak, They’d Say Her Name
headline.print_headline: If These Walls Could Speak, They’d Say Her Name
